item.title: Trump hit a law firm with an executive order severely limiting the government from working with it. The same firm represented Hillary Clinton’s campaign
item.description: A spokesperson for the law firm called it “patently unlawful.”

item.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the economy may slow as part of a ‘detox’ from government spending
item.description: Bessent said employment should come from private companies, not the federal government.

item.title: The spectacular Synapse collapse: The ugliest divorce in fintech left $200 million in customer money frozen—and shows the risks of financial apps
item.description: Is the failure of this buzzy startup a canary in the coal mine for bigger problems in fintech?

item.title: CEO of $4.2 billion tech giant says defying Silicon Valley’s ‘move fast and break things’ mantra was essential to growing his business
item.description: The founder of dbt Labs Tristan Handy says moving at his own pace fostered innovation and growth—it can feel antithetical to the strategies of Google ...

item.title: Billionaire Barry Silbert’s Digital Currency Group launches crypto mining venture Fortitude
item.description: The new Fortitude venture will “look across the entire proof-of-work ecosystem to say what’s going to give us the largest return.”
